column5: An applied and computational mathematics master’s degree that is designed for you to create innovative computing solutions, mathematical models, and dynamic systems to solve problems in industries such as engineering, biology, and more.92% Outcome Rate of RIT Graduates from this degree $87.6K Average First-Year Salary of RIT Graduates from this degree30% Merit scholarship Average award given to accepted studentsCo-op/Internship EncouragedSTEM-OPT Visa
